Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black; part of floral motif in added red and added white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of goose (leg and lower body), to left; dot rosette and rising roundel as filling ornament; below, part of one horizontal band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The interior decoration is not consistent with the Wild Goat Style, however, geese are very rarely represented in the later Mature Animal Style. This sherd perhaps marks the transition between both styles. For another goose depicted on Mature Animal Style vases, see UCL 757.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0407) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
